content: stocking hat ornament these directions are for a basic hat have fun mixing colors in stripes add additional row as needed to make a taller hat add a knit row between each decrease row size 1 double point needles or 32in or larger circular needle 7 yds fingering wt yarn approx i used a variety of my left over sock yarn pom-pom takes about 41/2 ft cast on 28 sts and divide for double points or magic needle to knit in the round join and k1 p1 rib for 4 rounds k for 7 rounds decrease k5 k2tog repeat to end of round k4 k2tog repeat to end of round k3 k2tog repeat to end of round k2 k2tog repeat to end of round k1 k2 decrease repeat to end of round k2tog repeat to end of round cut yarn and gather remaining 4 sts using tapestry needle make pom-pom using a table fork place a 6-8 inch piece of yarn through the middle tines of the fork and hold with the handle wind about 41/2 ft of yarn around tines with no gauge trying not to overlap i found that this works better than if the yarn is bunched up pull the loose piece of yarn around the middle of the yarn and tie as tight as you can it is easier to get a tight tie off if you take the yarn off the fork for the second part of the knot cut the loops fluff and trim the pom-pom as needed secure on top of hat
